title: Aerospace Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A aerospace benchmarks focus on technical and commercial de-risking. Investors compare your progress against industry timelines and capital efficiency standards. These metrics help demonstrate you're on track for production and revenue. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Technology Readiness Level
metrics.note: System prototype demonstrated in relevant environment (TRL 6) progressing toward full system qualification (TRL 8).

metrics.label: Manufacturing Readiness Level
metrics.note: Capability to produce prototype in production-representative environment with clear path to low-rate production.

metrics.label: Contract Backlog
metrics.note: Binding customer commitments: government contracts, firm orders, or committed pilots. Higher is better for aerospace Series A.

metrics.label: Government Funding
metrics.note: Cumulative non-dilutive government funding provides validation and extends runway. Major SBIR/STTR or prime contracts.

metrics.label: Customer Count
metrics.note: Enough customers to prove market interest without over-diversification. Quality and commitment level matter more than count.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Scaled team with engineering depth, manufacturing capability building, and business development presence.

metrics.label: Monthly Burn Rate
metrics.note: Burn varies significantly by aerospace segment. Hardware-intensive development requires higher burn than software-centric.

metrics.label: Time to Production Revenue
metrics.note: Realistic timeline from Series A to production-level revenue. Aerospace timelines are longer than softwareâ€”plan accordingly.

metrics.label: Capital Efficiency
metrics.note: Rough benchmark for capital required per TRL advancement. Varies by system complexity and test requirements.

metrics.label: Regulatory Completion
metrics.note: Significant progress toward required certifications and licenses. Major regulatory risks should be reduced.
